metadata.title: CVE-2020-12723 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description: regcomp.c in Perl before 5.30.3 allows a buffer overflow via a craftedregular expression because of recursive S_study_chunk calls. An application written in Perl would only be vulnerable to this flaw if it evaluates regular expressions supplied by the attacker. Evaluating regular expressions in this fashion is known to be dangerous since the regular expression engine does not protect against denial of service attacks in this usage scenario.]

criterions.comment: perl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
